start.speaker: toby
start.display: Knock, knock! Anybody home in there?

knockRe3.speaker: toby
knockRe3.display: Uh-oh! Should I tell Geneva you've gone off the deep end? You don't even know who you are?

knockRe4.speaker: ingram
knockRe4.display: Okay, that was actually kind of funny.

sec3.speaker: toby
sec3.display: So how's the underwater life? Feeling claustrophobic yet?

sec4.speaker: ingram
sec4.display: Maybe a little. I know we have a lot more space than they do on the ISS, but after a few weeks... Ugh.

sec5.speaker: toby
sec5.display: Ha! I certainly don't miss that. So how's the data coming along?

start.speaker: ingram
start.display: It's, uh... You know. It's coming along. Not very well. I'm still trying to figure it out.

sec1.speaker: toby
sec1.display: I didn't really want to say anything but... yeah, it hasn't been great. But I'm sure you'll get the hang of it!

sec2.speaker: ingram
sec2.display: You're right. I'll put more thought into it next time.

start.speaker: ingram
start.display: I think it's been coming along pretty well!

sec1.speaker: toby
sec1.display: I haven't heard any complaints yet, so you must be doing something right!

start.speaker: toby
start.display: Unless you had anything specific you wanted to talk about, I actually wanted to head out a little early today...

radio3.speaker: ingram
radio3.display: The radio isn't busted, is it?

radio3re.speaker: toby
radio3re.display: It wasn't the last time I checked. Why?

radio3re2.speaker: ingram
radio3re2.display: It turned on in the middle of the night last night. Or - I guess that's not quite it. It's normally pretty quiet unless one of you is broadcasting, but it started picking something up at like... two or three in the morning.

radio3re3.speaker: toby
radio3re3.display: That's weird. Why not just turn it off?

radio3re4.speaker: ingram
radio3re4.display: I - I don't - (sigh) I don't want to turn it off unless I have to. I'm kind of... cut off down here. There's the emergency button, yeah, but it's not like I'm having an emergency.

radio3re5.speaker: ingram
radio3re5.display: It's just creepy down here by myself and if someone is trying to talk to me on the other end of the radio, I'd like to know.

radio3re8.speaker: toby
radio3re8.display: I guess I can understand that.

radio3re9.speaker: toby
radio3re9.display: In any case, to answer your question, it might be picking up a signal from a passing ship. Or it could be aliens. Y'know. Always a possibility.

radio3re11.speaker: toby
radio3re11.display: Was there anything else? I'm gearing up to hit the road.

noDiscuss3.speaker: ingram
noDiscuss3.display: Nothing else to discuss, but why do you want to leave early? Do you have something going on?

sec2.speaker: toby
sec2.display: Yeah, uh. It's my niece's birthday soon? She's got a birthday party this weekend. I wanted to go later in the week but I've got some doctor's appointments.

sec3.speaker: ingram
sec3.display: Do you know what you want to get for her?

sec4.speaker: toby
sec4.display: I was just going to... you know... Go to the mall and hope I saw something inspiring?

sec5.speaker: ingram
sec5.display: How old is she? Or - how old is she turning, I guess.

sec6.speaker: toby
sec6.display: She's turning twelve. Or is she already twelve? Wait - no - (muttering) four, five six - no she's turning twelve.

sec8.speaker: toby
sec8.display: Uh... She's into, like... fantasy books? I can't remember if she's done with her dragon phase or not. And, uh. Anime.

sec9.speaker: ingram
sec9.display: Nobody "grows out" of their dragon phase. You just get more subtle about it.

sec11.speaker: ingram
sec11.display: You said she likes anime, though. Why not just get her something from a show she likes?

sec13.speaker: ingram
sec13.display: Oh, here's an idea. You finished building your 3D printer, right? Just print her something. What's that show called? Full Metal Jacket? The big armor guy?

sec14.speaker: toby
sec14.display: Okay, wow. First, it's called Fullmetal Alchemist. Second, that's... actually not a bad idea. I might go window shopping anyway. It's hard to go wrong with a really cool pen.

sec15.speaker: toby
sec15.display: Wait so was there anything else you wanted to talk about, or am I good to go?

sec16.speaker: ingram
sec16.display: No, we're all good. Go find that cool pen. Actually, if it's really cool, get me one, too. Bye, Toby.
